citeinfo.origin: Tohoku National Fisheries Research Institute (TNFRI), Fisheries Oceanography Division
citeinfo.title: Repeated Observation Line Along 37ﾰN by TNFRI

descript.abstract:
TNFRI maintains a repeated observation line along 37°N, which extends from the coast of Japan to 164°E. The line is observed once a year (May-June). Data include Chl-a concentrations, sub-surface nutrients, phytoplankton species, primary production, micro-zooplankton abundance, zooplankton species, micronekton, etc.
[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]
descript.purpose: To understand the ecosystem supporting the high productivity of the Mixed Water Region in the northwestern Pacific Ocean east of the Tohoku district.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
